content:
Sure, there are several Belgian beers that are commonly used in Flemish stew. Here are a few options:

1. Trappist beers, such as Chimay or Orval, are rich and complex and work well in Flemish stew. 2. Dark Belgian ales, such as Westmalle Dubbel or Rochefort 6, have a malty sweetness that complements the beef and other flavors of the stew. 3. Brown ales, such as Pauwel Kwak or La Chouffe, have a nutty, caramel flavor that works well with the beef and onions in the stew. 4. Flanders red ales, such as Rodenbach or Duchesse de Bourgogne, are sour beers that add a tangy, fruity depth of flavor to the stew. Remember to use a good quality beer that you enjoy drinking, as the beer will play a prominent role in the flavor of the stew. I hope this helps!
